---
description: The 'bingo' CLI for quickly developing templates locally.
title: Builder CLI
---

import { PackageManagers } from "starlight-package-managers";

When working on a Bingo template repository, it can be useful to quickly preview file changes locally.
Bingo provides a `bingo` CLI that directly runs a template.

For example, running a `./template.js` file:

<PackageManagers args="./template.js" pkg="bingo" type="dlx" />

```plaintext title="npx bingo ./template.js"
┌  ✨ bingo@0.5.0 ✨
│
│  Learn more on: https://create.bingo/build
│
│  Running with mode --setup for a new repository.
```

The path passed to `bingo` must resolve to a file that `export default`s a Bingo template.
See:

- [Concepts > Templates](/build/concepts/templates): for more information on what templates are
- [APIs > `createTemplate`](/build/apis/create-template): for documentation on how to create a template

## Common Flags

`bingo` supports all the flags under [CLI > Common Flags](/cli#common-flags).

For example, running a local `./template.js` file with a custom [`--directory`](/cli#--directory):

<PackageManagers
	args="./template.js --directory my-fancy-project"
	pkg="bingo"
	type="dlx"
/>

## Template Flags

`bingo` additionally supports any CLI flags added in by the template.

For example, if a template defines a `title` option, `--title` will be type `string`:

<PackageManagers
	args="./template.js --title 'My New App'"
	pkg="bingo"
	type="dlx"
/>

Any required options that are not provided will be prompted for interactively.

:::tip
See the documentation for your specific template for additional flags.
:::
